title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9-8-7-6 points: Stronger

THESE ESSAYS WILL ILLUSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES WITH VARYING DEGREES OF EFFECTIVENESS:

  1. Includes clear, well-developed analysis, especially in the upper ranges.

  2. Thesis may be implicit.

  3. Is well organized, on the whole.

  4. Addresses the terms of the question, but perhaps with some unevenness; may be superior in only one aspect (that is, physical description or social consequences) but must attempt to both:

    • describe the physical transformation of cities over the course of the nineteenth century, and

    • analyze the social consequences of that transformation.

  5. Offers at least some specific examples to support the analysis.

  6. There may be some errors in this group; even a "9" need not be flawless.

5-4 points: Mixed

THESE SCORES SHOULD BE ASSIGNED JUDICIOUSLY.

  1. The thesis, if there is one, is superficial or simplistic.

  2. Describes some of the physical changes in cities, and discusses at least one or two of the social consequences, but with limited analysis and substantial unevenness.

  3. Shows limited awareness of change - chronological or geographical- during the nineteenth century.

  4. Limited specific information, some possibly irrelevant.

  5. This group may contain errors, factual and/or interpretive.

  6. These ranks should be assigned judiciously (rarely and after careful thought).

3-2-1-0 points: Weaker

THESE ESSAYS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES TO VARYING DEGREES. ESSAYS SCORED 0 OR 1 MAY ATTEMPT TO ADDRESS THE QUESTION, BUT FAIL TO DO SO ADEQUATELY.

  1. Thesis and/or analysis confused, unfocused, absent, or simply restates the question.

  2. May focus mainly on description or on the earlier years of the century.

  3. Supporting information, if any, may be superficial or irrelevant; may use few examples or illustrations, and fails to relate them to the question.

  4. Will have little or no substance other than general knowledge about cities or the Industrial Revolution.

  5. May contain major errors.

— Non-responsive

Response totally off-task, absent, or irrelevant.
